info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 3:15PM EDT until July 09 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Schenectady County in east central New York... Northeastern Albany County in east central New York... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 315 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Albany, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Albany, Colonie, Latham, Delmar, Guilderland, Menands, Loudonville, Shakers, Bleecker Stadium, Normansville, West Albany, Karlsfeld, Boght Corners, Maywood, Karner, Hartmans Corners, Dunsbach Ferry, Fort Hunter, North Bethlehem and Newtonville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
